intro: Megalastrum atrogriseum, commonly known as the dark-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its evergreen, leathery leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant relies on its host for water and nutrients, while it provides some protection against herbivores through the production of toxic compounds. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forest canopies where it thrives in shaded environments. Its unique ecological role makes it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
